As a small, residential liberal arts college in Eastern Washington’s Walla Walla, Whitman has what it takes to provide an education that goes beyond the classroom. Whitties are scholars, but also explorers and scientists. They climb mountains, travel to far-off corners and advocate for social justice. They care about community and aim to become citizens of the world. A Whitman education is rooted in the traditional liberal arts values like critical thought and academic rigor; add in prestigious internships, off-campus study and civic engagement opportunities, and it becomes more than the sum of its parts. 2016 NEEDS: Middle Hitter, Right Side, Outside Hitter, Setter, Libero
SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: Middle Hitter: Strong blocker must be able to consistently and aggressively attack both in front and behind the setter. Lost starting middle to injury so we are looking for athletes interested in competing for a starting role right away. Right Side Hitter: Aggressive attacker and blocker. Outside Hitter: Must have excellent first contact skills and the ability to play six rotations, if necessary. Setter: Looking for a setter with excellent decision making and defensive skills. Club experience a must. Libero: Excellent first contact and defensive skills. Must also have the ability to step in and set in out of system situations.
SCHOLARSHIP? No athletic scholarships available. Many academic scholarship and grant opportunities available based on GPA and other factors.

Must also have the ability to step in and set in out of system situations.

Outside Hitter: Must have excellent first contact skills and the ability to play six rotations, if necessary. Setter: Looking for a setter with excellent decision making and defensive skills. Club experience a must. Libero: Excellent first contact and defensive skills. Must also have the ability to step in and set in out of system situations.
SCHOLARSHIP? No athletic scholarships available. Many academic scholarship and grant opportunities available based on GPA and other factors.

PrepVolleyball.com is pleased to bring back our College Needs List, a look at those colleges that both have recruiting needs and the willingness to publish them. Before our 2013 website makeover, the Needs List was something that was automated and an important part of Prep. With the ownership change as of last year, it will be automated again soon enough but was too important to delay. For now, we’re doing this old school, in a low-tech way. Below please find the needs for 133 colleges and universities, including more than 45 in NCAA Division I, updated with seven new schools since last Friday. As you peruse the schools and their needs, please respect their special requirements. If a school seeks a middle 6-1 or taller and you are a 5-9 middle, that is not the school for you. We will update the needs list every Friday, as necessary, both with new listings and with modifications to the original listings. New listings – following precisely the format below – as well as modifications should be sent to john@prepvolleyball.com and contain “College Needs List” in the subject line. Thanks. And to those we hope to benefit by the return of the Needs List, both schools and prospective student athletes, we wish you best wishes on your journey to finding the right fit for you! They also need to be able to move horizontally well. SCHOLARSHIP? Yes. We have a variety of scholarship available to potential athletes. 2018 NEEDS: S, M, OH SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: Outsides should have high volleyball IQ and be successful in all six rotations. Middles need to be able to hit a variety of sets. They also need to be able to move horizontally well. SCHOLARSHIP? Yes. We have a variety of scholarship available to potential athletes. 2019 NEEDS: S, M, OH SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: Outsides should have high volleyball IQ and be successful in all six rotations. Middles need to be able to hit a variety of sets. They also need to be able to move horizontally well. SCHOLARSHIP? Yes. We have a variety of scholarship available to potential athletes. BRIEF SCHOOL DESCRIPTION: Azusa Pacific University is a leading Christian college ranked as one of the nation’s best colleges by U.S. News & World Report and The Princeton Review. Located near Los Angeles in Southern California, APU is a Christian university offering associate’s, bachelor’s, master’s, doctoral, and degree completion programs, both on campus and online. SCHOOL NAME: Indiana University LOCATION (City, State): Bloomington, Indiana DIVISION: NCAA D1 CONTACT NAME: Jason Oliver CONTACT PHONE#: 812-345-4906 CONTACT E-MAIL: jasolive@indiana.edu VOLLEYBALL WEBSITE ADDRESS: http://iuhoosiers.com/index.aspx?path=wvball& 2019 NEEDS: Outside Hitter SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: Touching at our around 10 feet. SCHOLARSHIP? Yes – we have 4 scholarships available in 2020 BRIEF SCHOOL DESCRIPTION: Indiana University is a public research university located in Bloomington, Indiana, United States. With over 48,000 students, IU Bloomington is the flagship institution of the Indiana University system and its largest university. IU ranks in top 100 national universities in the United States and the top 50 public universities in the country. There are more than 650 student organizations on campus, and over 350 majors. The campus is right in the heart of beautiful Bloomington IN and includes abundant green space and historic buildings dating to the university’s reconstruction in the late nineteenth century. While not having a mascot all of the 24 sports are known as “Hoosiers” and compete in the Big Ten conference. SCHOOL NAME: Indiana University of Pennsylvania (IUP) LOCATION (City, State): Indiana, PA DIVISION: II CONTACT NAME: Scott Pennewill, Head Women’s Coach CONTACT PHONE#: 724-357-3198 CONTACT E-MAIL: spenn@iup.edu VOLLEYBALL WEBSITE: http://www.iupathletics.com/index.aspx?path=wvball 2019 NEEDS: OH, Pin hitters. SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: We would like the OH to be a six rotation player with excellent passing skills. Proficient in her ability to terminate out of serve receive. Unshakeable confidence and wants the ball at crunch time. All pin hitters should be strong and confident and able to overcome setbacks quickly and compete on every ball. Coachable and a team player first and foremost. All players should be of a growth mindset with a strong work ethic. SCHOLARSHIP? Partial scholarships that are augmented with need and merit based financial aid. BRIEF SCHOOL DESCRIPTION: IUP is located 57 east of Pittsburgh, PA. IUP is a member of the Pennsylvania State Athletic Conference. Long-known as the NCAA’s largest one-state conference, the PSAC now consists of 18 institutions located within the Commonwealth. The IUP Volleyball program, in 2014—15, had the number one GPA in the PSAC, of any sport, a statement to our academic emphasis and success. With 130 undergraduate majors, we offer the athlete the opportunity to pursue their career path. Undergraduate populations is just over 13,000, making us a perfect medium sized school. Not too small and not too big. The volleyball team competes in the Kovalchick Convention and Athletic Center, a 5,000 seat arena, which is state of the art. A pro-style team locker room, complete with meeting area and two big screen TV’s, is the perfect place for your gear and preparations. Our University and our Volleyball program at IUP take pride in our’ family style’ approach to the student life experience. A beautiful, friendly campus built in 1842 with a wonderful mix of old and new. We have amazing travel learning experiences, small classroom sizes, with actual professors that teach the courses. Our campus sits in the middle of downtown Delaware, a friendly and fun town full of boutiques, breweries and restaurants – and while we are a small student body (1800-2000 students), we are very diverse with students from all over the country, and our residential campus is full of wonderful social interaction. Athletics is a major part of our campus where you will be supported in the classroom, on the court, and in your life. We encourage life balance, which means you will have the opportunity to be trained at a high level, as well as encouraged and supported to have experiences outside of your sport. Become a Battling Bishop! The U offers the best of both worlds with Park City Ski Resort 15 minutes away from campus and just 10 minutes the other way all the benefits of beautiful Downtown Salt Lake City. The University of Utah ranks among the top public research universities in the nation. From university-developed technology, the U. has launched nearly 127 new startups over the last seven years, consistently placing it in the top 10 in the nation for university startup creation. Last year CBS Sports ranked the University of Utah Athletic Department 11th of all NCAA Athletic Programs. With ever increasing resources the University of Utah Athletic Facilities continue to expand, grow and become some of the top athletic training facilities in the nation. The power of the PAC-12 also allows for increasing support for our student-athletes in all areas of performance, academic and future endeavors. Beth Launiere has served as Head Coach of the Utes for the past 27 years. SCHOOL NAME: Ball State University LOCATION (City, State): Muncie, IN DIVISION: D1 CONTACT NAME: Kelli Miller CONTACT PHONE#: 765-285-1123 CONTACT E-MAIL: kmiller2@bsu.edu VOLLEYBALL WEBSITE ADDRESS: www.ballstatesports.com/womensvolleyball 2017 NEEDS: OH, MH SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: SCHOLARSHIP? No full ride athletic scholarships available. Open to athletes who would consider 1, 2 or 3 year offers. 2018 NEEDS: OH, MH, RS SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: OH- We are looking for a 6 rotation attacker that’s comfortable passing to attack. We are looking for someone with quick foot speed and a fast arm. We like to play a fast tempo offense, so we need an attacker who’s quick, can hit shots and simply gets after it on the court. The ball control piece is big for this position as we like our offensive players to be able to move around after they pass to run various routes. We also like the OH to be able to attack from the back row as well, so having someone who’s comfortable with their ball control is important. MH- We are looking for a MH that likes to run off one foot to attack. She needs to have quick feet and a fast arm as well. We love to set slides and other various one foot attacking sets, so having someone that can chase and get on the ball quick is important. We would like her to be approach touching at 10’ or above so that she can be successful at blocking as well. Competitive drive is also important in this position. Our middles work hard so we can get them the ball so they lots of effort and grit. RS- We are looking for a 2 foot attacker that can terminate at the pin. She can hit 2nd tempo balls as well as traditional behind the setter sets. She needs to be a blocking presence. Foot speed is good, but fast arm and hitting a heavy ball is more important. SCHOLARSHIP? Yes, available for all positions 2019 NEEDS: OH and open to other positions depending on how previous recruiting classes develop SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: Could be O1 or O2, but definitely someone with foot speed and a good arm. Libero- ball control and a play maker SCHOLARSHIP? Yes BRIEF SCHOOL DESCRIPTION: Ball State is located in Muncie, IN and offers over 190 majors. Our enrollment is around 21,000 students and we play in the Mid-American Conference. SCHOOL NAME: Marietta College LOCATION (City, State): Marietta, OH DIVISION: III CONTACT NAME: Bob Howard CONTACT PHONE#: 740-376-4902 CONTACT E-MAIL: Reh002@marietta.edu VOLLEYBALL WEBSITE ADDRESS: http://pioneers.marietta.edu 2016 NEEDS: Looking for a large class in 2016 with 4 positions opening up in 2016 and another 2-3 possibly opening in 2017. We expect the 2016 class to define our program for several years. Looking for a starting level setter, looking for a power hitting outside or right-side hitter, looking for a ball-control OH (L2) and a middle blocker. SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: Setter – run a strong middle-oriented offense, accurate and consistent in her delivery while jump-setting most every ball. Blocking height is a factor since we run a 5-1. Power hitter (OH or RS) – 5-10 or bigger, powerful enough to beat the block at the net, disadvantage the defense out of the back row and put up a strong block. MB (5-11 or bigger) – an imposing blocker, long and agile enough to impose all along the net. A strong hitter, able to run a variety of quick attacks in both serve receive and transition. L2 (5-8 or bigger) – looking for a dynamic player who can hold their own at the net while providing libero-type passing and defense. DS – provides precise ball control passing and digging, aggressive and quick enough to cover more than their share of the court. At all positions we value length, athleticism, intelligence and aggressiveness, players who are good students and great teammates. SCHOLARSHIP? Marietta is an NCAA D-III college and, thus, does not offer athletic scholarships. We do, however, offer academic scholarships, merit grants and a full array of need-based aid. 2017 NEEDS: Looking for upgrades at any position, players who can compete at the National level in D-III. Setter, power outside or right-side hitter, middle blocker, ball control OH or DS. SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: Setter – starting potential at 2 positions (e.g., setter/DS, or setter/RS). Accurate and consistent jump-setter, able to run a quick tempo, middle-oriented offense. Power hitter (OH or RS) – 5-10 or bigger, powerful enough to beat the block at the net, disadvantage the defense hitting out of the back row and put up a strong block. MB (5-11 or bigger) – an imposing blocker, long and agile enough to impose all along the net. A strong hitter, able to run a variety of quick attacks in both serve receive and transition. L2 and/or DS – 5-8 or bigger, someone who passes and digs precisely while covering a large portion of the court and, at L2, can still hold their own at the net. At all positions we value length, athleticism, intelligence and aggressiveness, players who are good students and great teammates. SCHOLARSHIP? Only need-based financial aid BRIEF SCHOOL DESCRIPTION: Princeton University is a vibrant community of scholarship and learning that stands in the nation’s service and the service of humanity. Chartered in 1746, Princeton is the fourth-oldest college in the United States. Princeton is an independent, coeducational, nondenominational institution that provides undergraduate and graduate instruction in the humanities, social sciences, natural sciences and engineering. As a world-renowned research university, Princeton seeks to achieve the highest levels of distinction in the discovery and transmission of knowledge and understanding. At the same time, Princeton is distinctive among research universities in its commitment to undergraduate teaching. Today, more than 1,100 faculty members instruct approximately 5,200 undergraduate students and 2,600 graduate students. The University’s generous financial aid program ensures that talented students from all economic backgrounds can afford a Princeton education. Sam Houston State is a NCAA Division I athletic program with over 80 undergraduate programs, 50 master’s programs, and 6 doctoral programs. Some of our most sought out programs include Kinesiology, Nursing, Business, and top-5 nationally ranked Criminal Justice. The volleyball program competes in the Southland Conference, and historically finishes in the top three every year. Yes BRIEF SCHOOL DESCRIPTION: UH is located in Houston, Texas, the nation’s fourth-largest city and the energy capital of the world. Founded in 1927, the University of Houston is the leading public research university in the vibrant international city of Houston. UH is home to more than 40,000 students and offers undergraduates 120 majors and minors. UH was ranked #4 in the nation in “12 Top Colleges Where Students Get the Best Bang for Their Buck.”. The University of Houston is the second most ethnically diverse major research university in the United States. UH is the home to one of the most storied athletics programs in the nation. The Cougars have won 62 NCAA individual championships and 17 NCAA team titles, been in 21 bowls, appeared in five NCAA Finals Fours in men’s basketball, and earned a berth to the College World Series. UH offers 17 intercollegiate sports and compete in the American Athletic Conference. A member of the University of North Carolina system, WCU now provides an education to more than 10,000 students from 48 states and 35 countries. The university’s mission is focused on quality education and preparation for responsible citizenship in a changing world. Since its founding, WCU has grown in size to become a major cultural, scientific, and educational force in the region and the state—and we’re still growing. Our academic programs span more than 120 specialities—including the nation’s highest-ranked entrepreneurship and project management programs, a national award-winning teacher education program, a criminal justice program used as a model for North Carolina’s accreditation program, and the nation’s first accredited four-year emergency medical care program. Henry, and National Endowment for the Arts awards—to name a few. Small classes. Global connections forged under the guidance of dedicated faculty members. The support it takes to turn college into limitless opportunity. What Whitman College has, it shares. As a small, residential liberal arts college in Eastern Washington’s Walla Walla, Whitman has what it takes to provide an education that goes beyond the classroom. Whitties are scholars, but also explorers and scientists. They climb mountains, travel to far-off corners and advocate for social justice. They care about community and aim to become citizens of the world. A Whitman education is rooted in the traditional liberal arts values like critical thought and academic rigor; add in prestigious internships, off-campus study and civic engagement opportunities, and it becomes more than the sum of its parts. The Whitman experience transforms, allowing students to turn education into life.
